definition: Shakespeare/slang or popular culture abbr. of 莎士比亞|莎士比亚[Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4]
see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]
katydid (family Tettigoniidae)/phonetic "sha" used in transliteration
surname Weng
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)

sentences.english: Shakespeare' s sonnets are the only direct expression of the poet' s own feelings.
sentences.chinese: 这些十四行诗都是莎翁直抒胸臆的成果。

sentences.english: They clearly enjoy working with him and with Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 他们显然很喜欢和他共事莎翁的名剧。

sentences.english: Legendary plays were written by W. Shakespeare in his late life.
sentences.chinese: 莎翁传奇剧是莎士比亚的晚期创作。

sentences.english: They should have the rest of Shakespeare's works done in no time.
sentences.chinese: 于近期内完成莎翁余下的作品应不成问题。

sentences.english: Shakespear's life gives us a strong feeling of Foreordination.
sentences.chinese: 莎翁的一生给人一种强烈的宿命感。

sentences.english: He is a Shakespeare in his dramatic skill.
sentences.chinese: 在戏剧技巧方面他可以说是莎翁再世。
莎翁比萨饼，免费提供筷子。

sentences.english: Shakespeare's sonnets are the only direct expression_r of the poet's own feelings.
sentences.chinese: 这些十四行诗都是莎翁直抒胸臆的成果。
